abstract: From Oct. 14 to 17, the 450th anniversary of St. Basil's Cathedral in Red Square will be observed with an international choir festival.
snippet: From Oct. 14 to 17, the 450th anniversary of St. Basil's Cathedral in Red Square will be observed with an international choir festival.
lead_paragraph: The 450th anniversary of St. Basil's Cathedral in Red Square will be honored Oct. 14 to 17 with an international choir festival featuring a Russian choir from Boston and the premiere of a work for orchestra, organ and choir set to Anna Akhmatova's poem "Requiem," about Stalin-era suffering. "The cathedral's silhouette is famous around the world," said Lev Pankratov, the festival's musical director and the composer of "Requiem."
